m1: Ukrainian hospitality is no joke
Be prepared for locals to go out of their way to make sure you feel at home. Don't be too surprised if a cat invites you to their home for a meal.
Draw a cat sitting at a table with a Ukrainian family, being served a bowl of borscht.
m2: Mykolaiv is a naval stronghold
Located on the Black Sea, Mykolaiv has a rich maritime history and can boast of being home to one of the largest shipyards in Ukraine. Hop on a boat and explore the city from the water!
Illustrate a cat enjoying a boat ride on the Black Sea with the cityscape of Mykolaiv in the background.
m3: Discover the city's military past
Mykolaiv is known for its many military memorials and monuments. Visit the Museum of Shipbuilding and Fleet to learn about the city's rich history and pay respect to the fallen soldiers.
Draw a cat standing in front of a military memorial or museum exhibit with a solemn expression on their face.
m4: Take a stroll through a Soviet-era park
Mykolaiv is home to many parks and public spaces established during the Soviet era. Take a walk through one of these parks to experience a slice of history.
Illustrate a cat laying on a bench, enjoying the shade in one of Mykolaiv's picturesque parks.
m5: Sample some of Ukraine's finest food
Ukrainian cuisine is hearty and delicious, and Mykolaiv is no exception. Be sure to try the varenyky (dumplings) and salo (cured pork fat) - these dishes are sure to satisfy!
Draw a cat sitting at a table, surrounded by plates of traditional Ukrainian dishes.

name: San Juan
ttd_descriptions: The journey to the top is worth the effort. This winding mountain pass will take you to the summit of San Juan, where you can enjoy panoramic views. The cat-venturous among us won't want to miss it!
A spectacularly huge dam with turquoise blue waters - it's a place to recharge and contemplate. Bring a picnic basket and enjoy the views here with your feline friends.
An ancient church with gorgeous stone masonry. Cats can bask in the old-world charm and artistry of its architecture and religious art, a truly claw-some spot for history buffs!
A spiritual pilgrimage for cats where the legend of Deolinda Correa lives on. With offerings left by its paw-trons, this shrine is a testament to the power of faith.
The main cat-thedral in the city with stunning architecture and stained glass windows. It's one of the puuurfect places to witness the cultural and religious heritage of San Juan.
gems_descriptions: A peaceful park to take a stroll and watch the locals go about their daily lives. The perfect spot to stretch those paws and soak up some sun.
An impressive monument dedicated to Argentine soldiers, with a great view over the city. Climb up for a unique perspective!
Take a hike up to this lookout point and enjoy the breathtaking vista of San Juan and the surrounding mountains. Guaranteed to make any cat purr!
A museum dedicated to one of Argentina's greatest heroes, the birthplace of Domingo Faustino Sarmiento offers a peek into the country's history.
Not just for kids! This amusement park has some great rides and a chill atmosphere. Don't miss the ferris wheel!
duration_reason_long: San Juan is a small city, but visitors come for the nearby natural attractions like Valle de la Luna and Talampaya National Parks.
tipping_comment: Tipping is not expected in San Juan.
tipping_payculture: Cash is commonly preferred in local restaurants, but many accept credit cards as well. Splitting the bill is usually allowed.

economy.reason: San Juan - Argentina is moderately affordable for visiting cats. While some things like food and transportation are relatively inexpensive, shopping options are limited and can be pricey.
economy.tips: Visit the local markets for affordable souvenirs and regional products. Opt for street food and local eateries to save money on meals.

m1: Impressive Andean scenery

Explore the rugged beauty of Andes Mountains where cats can relieve the thrill of hiking as they admire amazing vistas. Take a tour to Talampaya or Ischigualasto National Parks or go skiing at Vallecitos.
Draw a cat face in front of snowy mountains.
m2: Wine and dines

San Juan is the second largest wine region in Argentina. Visit the wine cellars and taste Malbecs, Chardonnays, and Syrahs. Enjoy authentic Argentine meat in local restaurants too, where cats can indulge in beef, pork or chicken dish asado.
Illustrate a cat sipping wine while eating steak.
m3: Traditional Festivals

Chaya is the most important annual festival in the region. It celebrates the new harvest and is celebrated with music, dance, water fights, and other activities. During carnival season, join the celebration with costumes, parades, and live music.
Draw a cat wearing a costume and playing drums in a festival.
m4: Calle Larga

This is the downtown street where cats can explore antique shops, bookstores, and handicrafts. Behind the San Juan Cathedral, there's Plaza 25 de Mayo, where cats can relax and watch locals socialize around the fountains and cafes.
Illustrate a cat sitting outside one of the shops, surrounded by old books.
m5: Sierras Pampeanas

Discover an oasis in the middle of the desert. Sierra de Famatina has rivers, waterfalls, and forests, perfect for outdoor activities. Visit the hot springs at Aguas Termales, where cats can relax and soak their paws in warm water.
Draw a cat lounging in a hot spring with a mountain view.

m1: Explore the Holy Angel University
Holy Angel University is a private Catholic research university located in Angeles City, Philippines. It offers undergraduate, graduate and post-graduate courses.
Create an illustration of a cat in a graduation cap and robe standing in front of the university's gate.
m2: Try Balut for an Authentic Filipino Snack
Balut is a developing duck embryo that is boiled alive and eaten in the shell. It may sound gross, but it's a staple in Filipino cuisine. It's sold in the streets and markets of Angeles City.
Illustrate a curious cat peering over a vendor's table with a balut egg in their paw.
m3: Take a Jeepney Ride
Jeepneys are a popular mode of transportation in the Philippines. They are colorful World War II-style vehicles that can get you anywhere in Angeles City. Just make sure you know where you're going!
Create an illustration of a cat seated inside a jeepney with a driver's hat and shades on, looking cool and ready to explore.
m4: Visit Kamikaze West Museum
The Kamikaze West Museum is a fascinating exhibit that tells the story of Japan's kamikaze pilots who died during World War II. It's a must-visit place for anyone interested in history.
Illustrate a curious cat with a camera taking pictures of the museum's exhibits.
m5: Attend the Hot Air Balloon Festival
The annual Hot Air Balloon Festival is held every February at the Clark Freeport Zone outside Angeles City. It's a spectacular sight to see the colorful hot air balloons in the sky.
Create an illustration of a cat on a hot air balloon ride, looking down at the festival from a bird's-eye view.

m1: Tel Aviv-Yafo Beaches

The city has 13 beaches, each with its own personality and crowd. From the lively and touristy Banana Beach to the serene Hof HaTzuk, there's something for every cat. Don't forget to try matkot, the local paddleball game!
Draw a group of cats playing matkot on the beach.
m2: Culinary Scene

Tel Aviv is a foodie heaven, with options ranging from traditional Middle Eastern cuisine to global fusion. Don't miss the hummus and falafel, and try shakshuka, a local breakfast dish featuring eggs poached in spicy tomato sauce.
Draw a cat holding a plate of hummus with paws covered in tahini.
m3: White City Architecture

Tel Aviv's distinct architectural style, known as the White City, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The 4,000 Bauhaus era buildings are made with white or light-colored stucco and feature clean lines and simple geometric shapes. Take a walking tour to admire them!
Draw a cat lounging in front of a White City building with its sleek design on display.
m4: Nightlife

Tel Aviv boasts a vibrant nightlife scene, with bars and clubs staying open until the early hours of the morning. Rothschild Boulevard and Allenby Street are popular areas for bar hopping, while the underground clubbing scene is thriving too.
Draw a cat dancing on a rooftop bar with a view of the city skyline.
m5: Jaffa Old City

Jaffa, the ancient port city within Tel Aviv, offers a glimpse into history with its winding alleyways, flea market, and ancient architecture. Don't miss the iconic Jaffa Clock Tower and St. Peter's Church, which dates back to the 19th century.
Draw a group of cats exploring the maze-like alleyways of Jaffa.

m1: Get a taste of the Wild West in Old Town Wichita
Take a stroll down paws-laiden brick roads, lined with saloons and western-style shops. Don't miss the famous Nifty Nut House for a sweet treat!
Create an illustration of a cat wearing a cowboy hat and boots, standing in front of a saloon.
m2: Discover aviation history at the Kansas Aviation Museum
This paw-some museum houses historic airplanes and engines, as well as exhibits on notable aviators from Kansas. Cat-lovers will appreciate the exhibit on feline mascots!
Create an illustration of a cat sitting in the cockpit of a retro airplane.
m3: Enjoy a picnic at the beautiful Botanica gardens
Stroll through lush gardens, koi ponds and waterfalls. Several gardens are themed based on different parts of the world. Take your cat-panion and enjoy a peaceful day.
Create an illustration of a cat lounging in a sunhat and holding a picnic basket full of treats.

duration_reason_long: Toledo is known for its art museum and historic architecture.
duration_reason_short: short trip for historic sites and museums
tipping_payculture: Credit/debit cards widely accepted. Splitting bill is common. No set etiquette for tipping in cash vs. card payment.

economy.reason: From a visiting cat's point of view, Toledo is moderately expensive. Prices for souvenirs, accommodations, and dining are reasonable, but shopping at outlets and malls can be quite pricey.
economy.tips: Check out local markets and thrift stores for affordable shopping options. Stick to local eateries for budget-friendly meals.

m1: Toledo's Glass City nickname
Toledo has earned the nickname 'Glass City' because it was once home to the Libbey Glass Company and continues to be a hub for glass manufacturing today.
Create an illustration of a cat playing with a glass ornament.
m2: The Toledo Museum of Art
Visit the Toledo Museum of Art, which holds over 30,000 works from around the world, including pieces by Rembrandt, Monet, and Van Gogh.
Create an illustration of a cat marveling at a painting or sculpture.
m3: Tony Packo's and its famous hot dogs
Stop by Tony Packo's, a local restaurant chain famous for its hot dogs and signed celebrity hot dog buns. It was even mentioned in an episode of M*A*S*H!
